meanings.definition: A political subdivision in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The demes in ancient Greece were like small neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: The demes worked together to govern themselves.
meanings.sent3: The demes had a friendly competition to see who could plant the most olive trees.
meanings.sent4: The demes stood as pillars of democracy in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent5: The demes were like puzzle pieces fitting together to form a larger picture.

meanings.sent1: The demes gathered for a community feast.
meanings.sent2: The demes supported each other during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The demes celebrated the harvest with a grand festival.
meanings.sent4: The demes were a close-knit group, always ready to lend a hand.
meanings.sent5: The demes thrived on unity and cooperation.

meanings.sent1: She demes the candies equally among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher demes the tasks to each student in the group.
meanings.sent3: He demes his time between work and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The chef demes the ingredients carefully for the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The manager demes the workload efficiently to the team members.
